intro: Selago persimilis, commonly known as the slender selago, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Selago persimilis is often found in the southeastern U.S., growing along the edges of wetlands and in damp, fertile soils.
